Column Comment.0: SOURCE DOCUMENT: A list of documents that are used as the source for supplyingdata. Source documents may include government and regulatory forms, operatorreports or scout tickets, publications, news letters, books or jounals.
Column Comment.1: AUTHOR ID: unique identifier for the author. May contain natural or surrogateinformation.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: AUTHOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE IDENTIFIER: unique identifier for an author in thecase where this information is validated against the Business Associate table.
Column Comment.4: AUTHOR FIRST NAME: The first name of the author of the source document.
Column Comment.5: AUTHOR INITIAL: Initial of the author of the source document.
Column Comment.6: AUTHOR LAST NAME: thelast name of an author of the document or article.
Column Comment.7: AUTHOR ORDER SEQUENCE NUMBER: The order in which authors are to bereported in a listing, with primary author first.
Column Comment.8: AUTHOR TYPE: the type of author of a document or other product. Could be who theproduct was created for, the company that created it, the person who created it, thescientist who was in charge etc.
Column Comment.9: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.10: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.11: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.12: REMARK: Geneal remarks about this row of data
Column Comment.13: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.15: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.17: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.20: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
